rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Very good teacher, but due to subject matter (anatomy), you have no choice but memorize LOTS of stuff. On his tests, Dr Padua likes to ask for the location of anatomical items, for ex. "what is the location of the scapula?" (Ans: C2 - T7; don't worry, it'll make sense to you when you take anatomy).

Really good teacher, and interesting subject.  The tests are easy as long as you are able to memorize, no surprising or trick questions.  The lectures can get kind of boring, but not bad.  Beware of TAs though, the days that the TA teaches are awful and I could barely pay attention.
